page.title: 05Fortification
page.content: Between 1878 and 1881, three gun batteries were built on the north-west, north-east and south headlands, but only two are visible today. They are constructed of rubble and are partly subterranean. To support the Inchkeith batteries a similar one was constructed on Kinghorn Ness.The Inchkeith batteries are listed building, but may soon be demolished. During the early 1900's the island was heavily armed and formed the principal part of the Forth defences in both World Wars. The military equipment has all been removed and the batteries, canteen and barracks stand derelict. Part of the "military" road is still visible because it is used by the lighthouse keepers to reach the foghorn on the north-east headland. Only the area not overgrown is that at the lighthouse.
